item.title: ZyXEL Port Forward Help
item.dc:creator: @Yoshi0308 Yoshi0308
item.description:
@Yoshi0308 wrote:

Actually, I don’t think it helped me out. I did exactly what you said I think. Is this how it should look like?

Oh yeah and when I’m logging into my server when people are on, do I type in my server IP? Or do I type in “localhost”?

Owners type in “localhost”, while other users type in the server IP, right?

EDIT: Will someone please help me??

Read full topic

item.title: ZyXEL Port Forward Help
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

yup but you need to put you computers ip in the ip slot…

ok to figure out your computers ip go to start control panel if you have it to windows xp view [not classic] go to network and internet connections, then on the bottom left network connections, now you see your computers connections here to figure out your ip click on the one that is connected it will open a little menu on the top go to the support tab once your there you should see somtin like this

address type - this is your network type how it is assigned

ip address - this is the one you need to look at

subnet mask - this is just a mask for your ip…

default gateway - this is just the ip to connect to your router

now take your ip from there and go to your router and just put the 4 sets of numbers in the box marked ip address

there you go hope i helped you out man…

Read full topic
